intro: Fuirena pachyrrhiza, commonly known as the thick-stemmed fuirena, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its stems are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid conditions. Fuirena pachyrrhiza produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
